column4: i am getting this error when trying to play DVD's in mplayer "failed to open dvd:\\1"....forums dont help
drako thats what the error says i typed it backwards
do you have libdvdnav installed from apt?
installed libdvdnav and i get the same error
do you have libdvdcss installed from apt? and you don't want libdvdnav installed from apt it messes with mplayer for some reason
libdvdnav was not originally installed, libdvdcss is installed
whats the full command your using with mplayer?
http://pastebin.ca/280555  <-- i need some help here my kernel wants to blow up on me
in the gui i am rightclicking and selecting open....DVD
do you have more then one drive?
open preferences and make sure the proper /dev line is in the dvd-device feild
but the other one is completely unresponsive (i think it is the drive)
try this command from terminal mplayer -vf lavcdeint -dvd-device /dev/cdrom0 dvd://1 (replace /dev/cdrom0 with the proper drive)
thanks a million....mplayer was pointing...well nothing (changed it to hdc and done!)
